block.p: Are toilets just vulgar? Not one can be seen in the bathrooms pictured in Carol Vogel's article "Bathing Beauties" (Design, April 21). Many an American has written off whole continents for want of a properly functioning, flushable toilet. I have seen friends, lifelong liberals brimming with cultural tolerance, turn into free-market capitalists for want of their favorite brand of toilet paper.
And what of the bidet? Of the seven bathrooms shown -- two in houses in Europe -- there is not a bidet to be found. TODD R. SNYDER
